quest.name: A Better Batrachoi
journal:
 Quest Sync
Kleon looks at you expectantly.

Kleon explains that he is concerned for the fate of his creations─namely, a concept he has named the “batrachoi.” It seems you are to follow the Amaurotine visitor to Rumination's Ramble, where Maira's brother, Alkaios, is tending to the observational subject in question.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level.
You find Alkaios with the batrachoi, but he is pessimistic about the creature's final evaluation. To demonstrate why, he asks that you give the batrachoi a solid poke.

Although designed to act as a guardian of waterways, the lack of response to your deliberate provocation has revealed the batrachoi's extreme docility. Kleon is devastated at the thought of having to abandon his beloved concept, but your suggestion to impart an aggressive attack to the creature may just have saved it from being retired altogether.

Kleon thanks you enthusiastically for your assistance, and hopes you will stay around to help him with another of his creations. Meanwhile, you try not to linger on the fact that you may have helped inflict the ancestor of the gigantoad upon the world...

dialogue.name: KLEON
dialogue.text: Thank you for agreeing to accompany us, Forename. Shall we?

dialogue.name: MAIRA
dialogue.text: Certainly. Now, what was the name of your creation again...?

dialogue.name: KLEON
dialogue.text: The “batrachoi”! A delightfully roly-poly pudding of a thing!

dialogue.name: MAIRA
dialogue.text: Ah yes, the one over at Rumination's Ramble! My brother, Alkaios, is in charge of tending to it. Right this way, if you please.

dialogue.name: MAIRA
dialogue.text: Thank you for your continued assistance.

dialogue.name: MAIRA
dialogue.text: This is my brother, Alkaios. He might seem a tad gruff, but don't be fooled─there are few more gentle or kind than he.

dialogue.name: KLEON
dialogue.text: There's my beloved batrachoi! Did he miss me, I wonder!?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The toad-like creature placidly endures your scrutiny.

dialogue.name: ALKAIOS
dialogue.text: You must be Forename. Maira has told me so much about you...in an impressively short span of time.

dialogue.name: ALKAIOS
dialogue.text: As you have likely already deduced, I am her brother, Alkaios.

dialogue.name: ALKAIOS
dialogue.text: And you are Kleon, yes? The architect of this “batrachoi” as you call them?

dialogue.name: KLEON
dialogue.text: Yes, yes I am! You think them ready for release? I would so love to see their endearing, rotund forms bouncing around free in the wild!

dialogue.name: ALKAIOS
dialogue.text: I've completed my report for the main evaluation criteria. The final decision will be made after a committee discusses the results, but based upon my personal observations...? No, they are not ready.

dialogue.name: KLEON
dialogue.text: No!? And might I ask why!?

dialogue.name: ALKAIOS
dialogue.text: Forename? Would you be so kind as to give this batrachoi a solid poke? The creature's lack of familiarity with you will help prove my point.

dialogue.name: ALKAIOS
dialogue.text: Go on, then. Before it hops away.

dialogue.name: MAIRA
dialogue.text: Alkaios would never ask if he thought you might be hurt, but do be careful of your toes─at that size, even a passive creature can be a danger to those around it.

dialogue.name: KLEON
dialogue.text: Do as he says, Forename, just...not too hard!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
You feel Alkaios's gaze upon you, silently judging...
Perhaps you should settle for giving the batrachoi a simple poke.

dialogue.name: ALKAIOS
dialogue.text: You see? No response to external stimuli. The creature is far too placid.

dialogue.name: ALKAIOS
dialogue.text: What was the concept behind the batrachoi? A defender of water sources?

dialogue.name: ALKAIOS
dialogue.text: In its current incarnation, it has neither the instincts nor the means to defend itself, much less fend off entities intent upon fouling the waterways.

dialogue.name: ALKAIOS
dialogue.text: I cannot, in good conscience, certify a subject so poorly equipped to carry out its intended purpose. In fact, I suggest you redesign your concept entirely.

dialogue.name: KLEON
dialogue.text: Thank you for your candor. <sigh> And I was so invested in this darling ball of pudgy flesh. Such a pity...

dialogue.name: MAIRA
dialogue.text: Forename, as Azem's familiar, you must have seen your fair share of the world and its inhabitants.

dialogue.name: MAIRA
dialogue.text: Without altering its physical form, what do you think the batrachoi could do to become a more effective guardian?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It could use its tongue to grapple opponents.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It could secrete an immobilizing slime.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It could use its weight to knock things flying.

dialogue.name: KLEON
dialogue.text: Brilliant! What an innovative mind you have, Forename!

dialogue.name: ALKAIOS
dialogue.text: Yes, that may suffice. The introduction of an effective offensive measure could very well tip the scales towards a favorable judgment.

dialogue.name: KLEON
dialogue.text: Truly!? Then I shall modify my concept at once!

dialogue.name: KLEON
dialogue.text: May I bind this one and take him home with me? Once I've finished making the necessary adjustments, I'll resubmit my request for observation and evaluation.

dialogue.name: ALKAIOS
dialogue.text: Of course, you are free to do as you wish. I will make a note of it in my logs.

dialogue.name: ALKAIOS
dialogue.text: I sense your suggestion was based on personal experience─a most valuable source of wisdom.

dialogue.name: MAIRA
dialogue.text: Well done, Forename. What a helpful familiar you are!

dialogue.name: MAIRA
dialogue.text: Kleon seemed so very pleased.

dialogue.name: KLEON
dialogue.text: Thank you for your creative assistance, Forename. I knew bringing you along would be a good idea!

dialogue.name: KLEON
dialogue.text: Why, I almost wish I could have you as my own familiar! It's a shame Azem hasn't published your concept for the world to see...

dialogue.name: KLEON
dialogue.text: But seeing as you're here now, would you mind lending me your talents a while longer? There is one other creation of mine that I feel may benefit from your unique perspective.
